text: welcome to brick lab and today we're
asking the question are women really
colder than men it can be perplexing
you're a woman sitting next to a man in
exactly the same conditions but you feel
colder than him all the time reports of
this nature have led to the belief that
women are naturally colder than men but
is this true well there are some gender
differences that could be at play here
women tend to have a lower metabolic
rate than men which means they generate
less heat throughout the body they also
tend to have more subcutaneous fat than
men which insulates their core some
studies do suggest that there could be a
slight difference with women having a
fractionally warmer core temperature
although we're talking in the region of
naught point two of a degree here so
it's hard to believe that this small
difference could be responsible for such
a widely held belief but there are also
other factors to consider some recent
research used a thermal imaging camera
to look at our response to declining
temperature so here we have Ben and
Claudia Benz on the left
and here's audio with the very funky
looking glasses for getting to feel a
bit chilly in this very cold air
conditioned room so the little outline
at the top of their head so they seem to
be losing some heat nerves they're
looking a bit blue so we're just waiting
to see really whether in the presence of
this cooling system there are any
obvious differences between our male and
female subjects in fact we can see
glorious fingertips are now going very
blue and Ben's off going red so we're
certainly beginning to see some evidence
that Claudia is cooling peripherally
more quickly than Benny
research has shown that in women when
faced with cold blood flow to their
extremities is restricted more quickly
than in men
one study found that their hands became
colder on average by three degrees
Celsius so what's happening here is that
as the temperature on the skin's surface
changes the blood of things diverges
away from the surface down into the
internal organs to try and maintain core
temperature and you can see that whereas
with Ben because his hands are still
orange red that's not happening so much
with Claudia the reaction is very
pronounced two hands and out quite blue
so it seems it's not a mist there are
differences between the sexes when it
comes to temperature are you more
sensitive to heat or cold why not share
